name: glossily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a smooth and shiny way: Her hair shone glossily. a full mouth, thickly and glossily lipsticked
in a way that looks attractive but often not having serious value or quality: Six hundred years of history has been glossily packaged and presented. a glossily packaged comedy with next to nothing to do with real human life See
glossy
More examplesFewer examplesThe plant keeps its glossily handsome leaves throughout the year.What can I do to protect long, glossily painted nails? It's a self-consciously stylish thriller, which succeeds in being glossily enigmatic, but fails to supply much substance.
